dublinCore.dc:title: 118 HR 614 IH: Commercial Fishing and Seafood Business Act of 2023
dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.

action.action-desc: Mr. Wittman introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on the Judiciary

form.official-title: To amend the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2005 to provide for the inclusion of certain workers in the exemption from numerical limitations on H–2B workers, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the Commercial Fishing and Seafood Business Act of 2023.

section.header: Inclusion of certain workers in exemption from numerical limitations on H–2B workers
section.text: Section 14006 of the Department of Defense Appropriations Act, 2005 (Public Law 108–287) is amended to read as follows:

The numerical limitation contained in section 214(g)(1)(B) of the Immigration and Nationality Act (8 U.S.C. 1184(g)(1)(B)) shall not apply to any nonimmigrant alien issued a visa or otherwise provided status under section 101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(b) of such Act (8 U.S.C. 1101(a)(15)(H)(ii)(b)) who is employed (or has received an offer of employment)—

paragraph.text: on a commercial fishing vessel or shrimp trawler; or

paragraph.continuation-text: Terms used in this section have the meanings given such terms in section 123.3 of title 21, Code of Federal Regulations.
